content:
STATISTICS 210 - STATISTICAL METHODS I: LINEAR MODELS

Fall Quarter 2019


Lecture:    Tu Th  9:30am-10:50am in Donald Bren Hall (DBH) 1300

Discussion: M 5:00pm-5:50pm in Rowland Hall 184

    instructor: Hal Stern
        office: 2216 Bren Hall
         phone: 949-824-1568
         email: sternh@uci.edu
  office hours: M 4:00-5:00pm

          NOTE: I have started a new position as Vice Provost for Academic Planning.
                I also have an office at 535 Aldrich Hall (949-824-9322).
  





Course text: 

The course text is Applied Linear Statistical Models by Neter et al. It is out of print.
Used copies may be purchased online from your favorite bookseller. As an
alternative I created an eBook of the chapters relevant to Statistics 210
that you can purchase here.

Course documents will be made available here:

Syllabus
Handout on installing R and RStudio
Introduction to R examples (from discussion on 9/30):
	Two sample randomization test and t-test on credit cards (generated data)
	Result of using R Markdown to create code/analysis document and source code
	Two sample t-test on cloud seeing example (demonstrates reading in data, transformation of data)

Homeworks:

Homework 1 (assigned 9/26, due 10/3)
	Nature editorial, ASA statement
	Solutions
Homework 2 (assigned 10/3, due 10/10)
	Ischemic (coronary heart) data
Homework 3 (assigned 10/10, due 10/22)
	Prostate data

Exams:


Lecture Notes:

Initial lecture notes (thru approx 10/22) 
Lecture notes - part II (thru approx 11/26) 
Lecture notes - part III (with bonus material!!)
